actions vs. words... i'm a very strong believer that actions speak louder than words. but at one time in my life, i remember thinking why couldn't he express how he felt, why didn't he write me poetry or even letters, why was it so hard for him to tell me sweet nothings. in a way, i think i felt i was missing something because he didn't do any of those things and with this mentality, our relationship went a rye. and that was the beginning of the end. it's been 9 1/2 months since we broke up. i know he was hurting alot and to this day, i still feel that he's bitter...not sure if that's a good word choice, but i still feel the anger and resentment that he still has for me everytime i see him. when we broke up, i really felt that we could be great friends, that things wouldn't change because i considered him my best friend for so long but that didn't happen. when we broke up, i lost him, i lost my best friend...the one person who knew my in's and out's and at times believed knew me better than my own family. even though he had a hard time expressing himself, i knew he loved me with every cell in his body. i knew he would do anything for me, i knew he would never break my heart. he's one of those rare guys out there that is actually good and what i mean by good is that he truly has a loving and trusting heart. not many out there. let's just say, whoever he may end up with is one lucky girl. this whole experience has been a very painful one. i've learned a lot about people and have come to realize what i should have known 9 1/2 months ago. i've reached a point in my life where words mean absolutely nothing until they prove that they can deliver. people can tell you one thing and really mean something else, people can lie to your face, people can twist your words, people can just be simply heartless when they want something so bad that they would say anything to get it. shut up already...heard it before, don't need to hear it again. i use to want someone who could talk and express words easily but after knowing what i know, i rather have a mute then a broken record. my only conclusion to this is...stay away from chatter boxes..you know the ones that tell you everything you want to hear.

hmm....another way to look at it "Simple Truths" by Kent Nerburn "It is a mystery why we fall in love. It is a mystery how it happens. It is a mystery when it comes. It is a mystery why some loves fail. You can analyze this mystery and look for reasons and causes, but you will never do any more than take the life out of the experience. Love is more than the sum of the interests and attractions and commonalities that two people share. And just as life itself is a gift that comes and goes in its time, the coming of love must be taken as an unfathomable gift that cannot be questioned in its ways. Too often, when love comes to people, they try to grasp the love and hold it to them, refusing to see that it is a gift freely given and a gift that just as freely moves away. When they fall out of love, or the person they love feels the spirit of love leaving, they try desperately to reclaim the love that is lost rather than accepting the gift for what it was. They want answers where there are no answers. They want to know what is wrong with them, or they try to get their lover to change, thinking that if some small thing were different love would bloom again. They blame their circumstances. They blame each other. They try anything to give meaning to what has happened. But there is no meaning beyond the love itself, and until they accept its own mysterious ways they live in a sea of misery. You need to treat what love brings you with kindness. If you find yourself in love with someone who does not love you, be gentle with yourself. There is nothing wrong with you. Love just didn't choose to rest in the other person's heart. If you find someone else in love with you toward whom you feel no love, feel honored that love came and called at your door, but gently refuse the gift you cannot return. Do not take advantage, do not cause pain. How you deal with love is how love will deal with you, and all our hearts feel the same pains and joys, even if our lives and ways are very different. If you fall in love with another who falls in love with you, and then love chooses to leave, do not try to reclaim it or to assess blame. Let it go. There is a reason and there is a meaning. You will know it in time, but time itself will choose the moment. Remember this and keep it in your heart. You don't choose love. Love chooses you. All you can really do is accept it for all its mystery when it comes into your life. Feel the way it fills you to overflowing, then reach out and give it away. Give it back to the person who brought it to you. Give it to others who seem poor in spirit. Give it to the world around you in any way you can. Love has its own time, its own season, and its own reasons for coming and going. You cannot bribe it or coerce it or reason it into staying. If it chooses to leave, from your heart or from the heart of your lover, there is nothing you can do and nothing you should do. Be glad that it came to live for a moment in your life. If you keep your heart open, it will surely come again. "

identity theft…. have you ever had a gut wrenching, heart pounding, head rushing and hands shaking experience all at the same time? well yesterday i felt all this and more. i felt so sick to my stomach that my entire afternoon, i felt like vomiting. here’s the story…. on october 15, 2002 i received a phone call from a man name nick perkins, a bank manager at the washington mutual branch in houston, texas. he tells me that they have a lady there who claims that i wrote her a check for $2500.00 and ask if i did in fact do this. my heart stopped for a split second as i tried to grasp at what he was saying. i couldn’t believe this was happening to me. with a shaky tone, i tell him “NO.” all of the sudden, i felt my mouth rambling on and on with endless questions of who, how, when, what, and why. the answers I received became more of a nightmare and more dissatisfying then expected. here’s the information i received on this lady: name: Jamie Clay gender: Female ethnicity: African American age: Mid twenties drivers license: Arizona apparently, jamie clay tried to cash a fake check at this washington mutual bank in texas. she knew my social security number, my mother’s maiden name, my driver’s license number, and my date of birth. god knows what other information she knew. when the bank teller questioned her about the check, she claimed that we had a fender bender one night at a club and I paid her off. luckily the bank teller was suspicious of her and notified me before cashing the check. he asked if I wanted to press criminal charges and of course i answered, “YES!” they called the police and once the police arrived at the texas bank, he gave me a call. here’s the officers’ information: name: Deputy Schields gender: Male department: Harris County Sheriffs Department phone #: deputy schields asked me a series of questions and after I confirmed everything, he said he had the lady under arrest and that he was going to take her to jail. damn hooker, she deserves everything she’s getting. anyway, he gave me the case # and said he would be in touch. down at the rancho san diego washington mutual bank, i spoke to naomi who was in charge of fraudulent activity division. she closed my accounts and gave me instructions on how to proceed with getting outstanding checks paid so they would not bounce. now i have to go through the hassle of canceling all my outstanding checks and everyone knows how horrible i am at balancing my checkbook so this will definitely be a pain in the ass. i’m seriously thinking about switching banks; i have nothing against WAMU but better safe then sorry. i also had to cancel my credit cards just in case that information was also stolen. i’ve called all 3 of the major credit bureaus- equifax, experian and transunion so they could put an alert on my accounts. i’m so sick of this bullshit….why can’t people just work hard for their money like the rest of us???? i still have a lot of phone calls to make but hopefully it will be all over soon. i have mixed emotions right now…i’m pissed that my identity has been stolen, my private information compromised, i feel so violated, i feel sad that there are evil people in this world that would go against what’s right to make money, i’m puzzled to how and who else has my pertinent information, i'm overwhelmed with stress, and now more then over i’m suspicious of people. i hate feeling like this. i know I trust a little to easily, which is one fault of mine. i’ve been told many times that i’m too soft hearted. well no more! i’m fed up with being taken advantage of. so don’t mess with me or you’ll end up like Jamie…in jail. that bitch definitely messed with the wrong tran!

to the skies.... you know sometimes i really amaze myself. i never thought i would actually carry out a new year's resolution and for the first time in 23 years, i did it...yes ME!! in 2002, i decided that i would exercise a lot and also do something i've never done as a child...travel by plane. i swear it was only 2 years ago that i actually flew on a plane...i guess you could say i was an airplane virgin. but this year changed dramatically. i've been on more airplane rides then i count on all fours. everytime i've gone, i would meet the most random people. twice i ran into Noel, this guy i use to live with in the dorms and we even flew to the same destination...twice! i also remember this one time (and no not at band camp) i sat by this women in her 40s, never married who tried to give me advice on men. she said "they'll no good and if you wanna be happy, never rely on a man". the duration of the trip consisted of male bashing. she's definitely been burned way to many times in her life. and then i met this other guy and a bunch of his friends on the plane. they were all from san diego. we exchanged numbers and have been friends ever since. i still remember the night at bar dynamite...giggles galore! but now my southwest buddy has moved to the city (sf) which i guess is cool since you all know how much i love to visit san francisco. i've never had a dull adventure at the airport, on the plane or at my desired destination. it's a memory i will soon not forget. i love flying, i love traveling, i love meeting new people. just being in a different environment, surrounded by unfamiliar faces, and a little power blaster...i lose all inhibitions, which isn't bad..not bad at all. i guess in a way, i could compare running to traveling. those who know me, know i love running outdoors. there's something serene about running in the open. all is see is beauty, a beauty so pure that i don't want to stop. as the wind blows gently across my face and as i start spacing out into the world before me, i feel free. no worries, just free. and so i guess running and traveling gives me the same high. it's nice to get away...away from the real world. so my next destination, vegas baby, cha-ching!

a prayer... days would past by, where u didn't hear from me...weeks gone by, and you still havent' seen me. a quick phone call here and there to let you know i wouldn't be coming home was all that was given to you. when i finished my last course, i know you thought i'd be home more cuz i didn't have school as an excuse to not come home. but the complete opposite took place and the visits and phone calls became less. it had been awhile since i've been home, i've was too wrapped up in all the fun..never wanting to plant my foot on the floor..always on the go. last week my older sister came home from stockton to visit. i finally had a reason to go home not that i never wanted to, i just figured everyone was busy but doing fine and that i wouldn't be too missed if i skipped a few weekends. what i went home to was a complete shock..a shock i could have lived without. instead of coming home to a house filled with love, laugher, smiles, and food...i came home to a house that was empty, no laughter, no smiles, and no mom's cooking. i decided to call my sister..thinkin' they were all actually at my grandma's house. i stepped in my parents room to use the phone and to my surprise, my mom was plopped on the bed all wrapped in her blanket. it was only 3:30 in the afternoon. as she lifted her head to see who was there, i jumped on the bed, hugged her tight and said "mommy i'm home!!" but the response i got back was a weak sigh. i took another look at my mom and realized she wasn't feeling well. if you all have seen my mom..you know she's a heathly women..a very strong women. but today was not the case..actually it's been a few days that she's been like this. she looked drained, she looked weak, she looked sad, she didn't look like mom. i asked her what happened, i asked why, i asked her when but she was too tired to talk. i laid in bed with her as i held her in my arms. we feel asleep together and was awoken 2 hours later by my sisters. they said they got the prescription for vicodin in order for her pain to subside.. the pain..wait...what pain? what was she feelin? what happened? why was no one was talkin? everyone kept quiet when i spoke, endless questions flew from my mouth..yet no response. i still didn't know what was wrong with her. i don't like being in the dark. i pulled my sister aside and asked her again to tell me what happened to mom. she said "while you were in vegas, mom went to the emergency room." i closed my eyes as she began to tell me the story. everything and nothing started running through my head. as i opened my eyes again, all i could say was "why didn't you call me..i don't care if i was out of town..i need to know these things. i want to know if anything happens to anybody in this family. i have the right to know." my mom is a fighter..it was only 6 years ago that the doctor told us that we might lose her but we didn't. she fought that battle and won. this is just another battle that lays on her shoulders now and the outcome of this one will be the same. it sucks that something bad has to happen in order for you to see what really matters in life. all the mini drama episodes..not so important anymore. i'm gonna go home a lot more now, i'm gonna be there for my family, i'm gonna do whatever i can to help my mom get better and when she does, i'll still be going home. i just hope this is enough. Not a day goes by that i don't think about her or pray for her. mom, i'll always be here for you..u can count on that. i luv you.

to ever fall again, it won't ever hurt like it did before. we've already reached the lowest and we both know that once you're down..the only way to go is up. and that's what we've done..picked ourselves up and looked at the world right in it's face. so now that we've overcome our fears and opened our hearts again, we're lettin' in a whole new level of uncertainty and vulnerability. but you know what?!? i don't care cuz i know myself now. i know who i am. and i know what i'm worth but i will tell you this, i'm glad we're going through this together! i wouldn't have it any other way!! but i doubt it..only in my dreams right?!?

distance makes the heart grow fonder... i was chatting with my girlfriend the other day and we were comparing our different views on missing people. she said that she loves to miss her toy..i mean boy. haha. anyways, she said that the feeling of missing someone portrays how much you really like the person or how much that person really means to you. she loves that feeling of missing cuz when she finally sees him, she's on cloud nine. i on the other hand did not like that feeling at one time... i didn't care much for the whole missing saga. yeah...i thought it was great when you got to see him again after sometime but the lag time in between the next visit..awww..definitely a killer. let's see... my friend see's her man everyday...and i really mean everyday cuz they work in the same building. so the only time she doesn't see him is when she's home, so the time in between missing him is fairly short cuz she'll see him again the next day. she enjoys missing him and i've come to believe it's because the time in between is not long enough where it starts to hurt. i've been in one long distance relationship and at first it wasn't too bad. i saw him very weekend but then slowly the visits were less and less. it became every other week, every three weeks, and eventually it seemed as if it was once in a full moon. k..i'm exagerrating but it was hard to be apart and i didn't like missing him. but i also think it had to do a lot of with trust issues. i didn't trust him but then again..he gave me reasons not too. and the gut wrenching feeling i would have everytime we talked..gave me bad vibes but that's a closed topic. anyways, getting back on the topic...i think it's true that distance makes the heart grow fonder but only if you have complete trust in other person. if you don't have it, it will definitely hurt because you'll always be wondering if the person is doing you wrong behind your back or what not. trust is what makes a relationship hold true. it's the peanut in the m&m, the sourcream in the carne asada burrito, the lobster dipped in butter, the boba in the avocado shake and of course, the pumpkin in the pumpkin smash. this time around, my feeling towards missing someone is a bit different. i don't feel the pain, i don't feel the hurt, and i don't feel the suspicions. what i do feel is a sense of sadness when he's away. i don't see him everyday like most people who are in relationships but the time that we are apart, he is still in my heart and that makes me happy, so i smile. i guess missing someone isn't so bad. :-) the distance has definitely made my heart grow fonder.

timing... i've come to accept that everything has to do with timing. everytime something would happen or would not happen, i'd say it had to do with the time and it just wasn't our time, and with this mentality, it keeps you sane. i've been through my share of heartaches and all the tears i've shed has only made me stronger. each time my heart gets broken, it never really completely heals, and when it breaks again, the cracks are always different. people always say that once you get hurt, it doesn't hurt as bad the second time around. i agree with that belief but only to a certain extent. the second time, the third time, whatever the case may be, the pain still stings, the tears still burn, the heart still aches. it doesn't hurt any less but the way you cope is different. you know better, you've learned from past experiences and you know life goes on. so dealing with the pain is easier but the hurt still stings to the bone. i think this past weekend proved to me that everything really does happen for a reason. but sometimes the reason may be different than what you expected and it just takes time to see that. a few months ago, the timing was right for that purpose, a month ago the timing was not right but yet we knew our time would come so we held on. after awhile confusion, misunderstandings, innocence began to plague our minds. and with a blink of an eye..it was dark again. dark and alone. i couldn't understand what happened or why it happened but i knew that it happened for a reason. i came up with reasons why which helped me deal but the fact was that after some time, the reason for it happening became crystal clear. it was in the cards, our cards. and even though we both felt pain, it had to happen for us to open up our eyes and see what really matters. and in all honesty, i'd suffer that pain again if that meant that it was the only way we could get to where we are right now. i guess you could say the timing couldn't have been more perfect.

40 days and 40 nights... so for lent my roomie and i gave up carbs...not all, but the major ones like bread, rice, pasta, potatoes, and sweets (fudgcicles, cookies, peanut m&m's, chocolate, cake, etc.). we got this brilliant idea after watching "40 days and 40 nights" (josh hartnett..mmm' definitely a hottie). anyways, after watching that flick, we decided to give up something that we both love and you all know what i love most..EATING. so we crazy girls decided to suffer 40 days without yummy, delicious, high carb foods to prove that we have will-power. yeah i know i'm not catholic..shoot, neither is she...but this gave us a reason to cut out the bad carbs and at the same time, lose a little weight. week 1 - first week without any high carbs..yup no rice...heaven knows how much we love rice and a day without it..it was indeed a sad day. but we survived. we started eating lots of green veggies and chicken. week 2 - we started feeling a little weak. we were slowly runnin' out of energy but that didn't stop us. we kept to our word and also started exercising regularly. running about 3 times a week around miramar lake. that kept us going... week 3- hmm..not so bad. don't miss rice, don't miss pasta, don't miss potatoes, but damn what i would do for a loft of bread and my thin mint girl scoot cookies that are hidin' in the back of my freezer. week 4 - we decided to eat bread at least once a week because someone told us if we eliminate it from our diet completely and start eating soon after our diet, we'd blow up like balloons...heck..that scared us so bread it was..but only once a week. week 5 - we're still runnin' almost every other night. our motivation still prevalent. we felt good about ourselves because we were eating healthy and exercising. only 2 more weeks to go... week 6 - uh oh..i think i started breakin' down by week 6..it had to be disneyland..i couldn't eat anything else but high carb foods... that's all they sold. it's notmy fault..so it was ok. funnel cake, churros, ice cream, cheeseburger, fries, chilli dogs, potatoe chips..man i was in heaven. so there we were..eating everything insight. yeah i felt a little guilty but it tasted so good that the guilt went away real fast. :-) WEEK 7 - last week and where am i?!? in vegas..damn..there goes my will power...mine and tazz. we only had 2 more days to reach our mark and we couldn't even do it. i needed pizza..a fat mushroom, pepperoni and olive pizza. mmm'. it was simply heaven. and so our lent ended a couple days before our target date of april 20th (for those who think that i lost at week 6, remember i'm not counting disneyland..it wasn't my fault..u don't expect me to starve do u? :-) since then, we've been eating like crazy and we stopped exercising. i really do miss running around the lake but these days it seems like i have an excuse for everything and anything not to go. our motivation is completely gone. also during those 40 days, we said we'd stop eating rice even after lent..but we didn't. it's back in our tummys. i think i need to find something else to do..i'm bored. i wanna do something spontaneous..something crazy. the only problem is..i don't know what. maybe for now, i'll just chill and watch the sunset and the sunrise...*smile*

my ideal date... i hate dating. it's definitely not my forte. i've always had a boyfriend or i was seeing someone...well since the high school days anyways. but last year i experienced the greatest thing ever, it was the best thing that could have ever happened to me and the timing couldn't have been more perfect. that was being on my own. i was single as can be... a free spirited girl ready to take on the world. i had so many crazy moments...so many unforgettable memories. i learned so much about myself and i realized how wonderful it was to be alone and to do things on my own and not feel one bit lonely. i actually enjoyed spending time by myself. i spent a lot of my days alone at the cliff on the beach. i dunno...there's just something so tranquil about watching the waves crashing on the shores and the sun setting across the horizon. it's amazing. it's beautiful. it's astounding. it made me happy. anyways, as much as i liked having my time alone, i still hung out with the opposite sex. it's a funny thing. the 10 months i was single, i "hung" out with a few guys but never once did i consider them dates. yeah, we might have done the dinner thing but i made it clear to them..it wasn't a date. i guess i was a little harsh but i really didn't want to date anyone. there were times where i had to straight out tell them that we were just hanging out cuz they called it a date but it sO wasn't in my book....no no dates for me. i guess i wanted to make it clear to them cuz i didn't want to lead any of them on. i really just wanted to chill and be single. well as much as i hated dating, i found myself wanting to when i met ricky. everyone knows how much i hate watching movies in the theaters. my girlfriends tried to get me to go forever but didn't succeed. but once ricky came into my life, i didn't even think twice about it. come to think of it, i think i asked him to the movies..haha. anywhoo..i'm here to prove a point that wanting something sucks cuz you just might get it. i was anti-dating for the longest time and finally when i felt i was ready, i think my prospect was scared to go on a date with me cuz we never hung out alone. we always hung out in big groups. yeah that was fun and everything but i really wanted the whole wine and dine me thing. i guess that's what i get for telling guys i don't date. my bad. :P i guess the main reason why i'm blogging about this is to share with everyone what my ideal date is. yeah i enjoy the whole wine and dine sha-bang so don't rule that out! haha. but what i imagine is him and me on top of a huge green hill...a waterfall behind us. the grass is a perfect shade of green, the sky is a sharp color blue with fluffy white clouds surrounding the gleaming warm sun. so there i am with him, butterflies in my tummy but all the same time i'm comfortable. he makes me laugh. we smile and we laugh again...we laugh until our stomachs hurt. it hurts so much that we both decide to roll down the soft green hill for fun. there we go tumbling down and finally when we get to the bottom there's a pumpkin smash jamba drink awaiting for us. we sip out of the same straw and splash our feet in the lake below us. he then decides to take me to my favorite spot. a place i didn't even know he knew about. we sit on top of the cliff with our feets hanging over and watch the beautiful sunset. he looks into my eyes and smiles. i melt. and then to end the date, he gives me a warm bear hug and kisses me gently on the forehead. *sigh*...now that's what a call a date. :-)
just something to think about.... " Life is not measured by the number of breaths we take, but by the moments that take our breath away."

-the cycle of friends- it’s weird to think how friends come and go. there was a time in my life when it was filled with their laughters, filled with their smiles, filled with their spirits and filled with their love. some of my fondest memories…just to list a few… the drives up the coast, the spontaneous trip to magic mountain at 3 pm in the afternoon, the karaoke night when we sang duets, the nights at bar dynamite, the conversations that lasted for hours, the 10 mile runs around calle cristo ball, the nights partying until the toilets became our best friends, the underage gambling in vegas, the 2am house painting brawls, and of course the most important…the friendship itself. this list is not just memories shared with one person but a collaboration of memories shared with friends that have come and go in my life. i’ve come to accept that friends are hard to find and good friends are even harder. i think i’ve been very fortunate enough to have shared my life with so many people. but as another year goes by, another friendship will lose momentum. for awhile, i was questioning why this was happening, was it something I said or did, or was it on their end. where did the fault lay, would things ever be the same, would they ever be a part of my life again. if they didn’t move away, would things stay the same. if their work wasn’t taking them in another direction, would there still be time for me, if they weren’t tied down, would we still be friends. the questions are asked yet the answers are already known. so why do I grasp at straws trying to find these answers? sitting here, my mind wonders, my thoughts typed out, my heart being heard. i’ve come to believe that the reason why friends come and go is because they’ve already accomplished their purpose. whatever the reason may be for their presence, i’m grateful they came and touched my heart and left a mark because without each imprint, i wouldn’t be where and who I am today. find yourself very lucky to stumble upon some friendships that last a lifetime but honestly, friendships like those are rare to find. As for the other friendships that come and go with the change in the season, i don’t find them any less important. for the short time they were in your life, the effect may have been greater than someone you’ve been friends with your entire life. i can’t keep questioning. i just have to accept that and I have. i know they came in my life for a purpose and i’m not bitter that they’re gone. maybe a little sad but the memories I hold will always be ingrained in the back of my mind. so with this said, my mind is more at ease. my thoughts are clear, my heart is free. and just to let you know, if you ever need a friend again, you’ll definitely find one in me.

i've had a lot of embarassing moments in my life. some events i would never mention to anyone even if my life depended on it but for most of these moments, i think they're worth sharing especially if i'm still laughing about it. on saturday, my friend invited me to a surprise birthday party for one of his friends. and although i've never met any of his friends before, i thought it would be fun to check it out. when i got to his house, my friend wasn't there yet and neither was the birthday boy. i walk into a room full of strangers and this guy introduces himself to me and then introduces everyone else in the room. he showed me around the house and shortly after, i plopped myself on the couch waiting for my friend to show up for the surprise. i looked down and i noticed that i was wearing my black sandals but i swore i was wearing white sandals. so i looked down at both feet and i saw my white sandal on my other foot. holy shit! i had a black sandal on one foot and a white one on the other. i thought to myself...no f*cking way am i wearing two completely different shoes. they weren't even the same height or the same style! one was dresser then the other. how did i not feel the difference? by now my heart was pounding, my mind was racing, and i could feel my face turning a rosy pink. all of sudden, i blurted out "hey look..i'm wearing two different shoes. it's the new trend. hahaha. ok.. (by now, my face has turned a bright shade of red) oh my god...um..i'm so embarassed. um..i live in my car and i slipped on the wrong shoes. ok.i'm gonna go to my car and get the other matching pair... hahaha. i'm such a dork." i then take off to my car to grab the other shoe. i know for a fact that after i left, the laughter probably increased by 110%. yes i'm an idiot. so i come back to the party and everyone is just laughing and i can't help but to laugh right along with them. it was definitely an ice breaker. i was now the center of attention and everyone was asking me questions. the rest of the night consisted of great food, good music, and the constant teasing of my new trend. it was great...i'm happy everyone had a good laugh even at my expense. for sure they will never forget me. anyways, word has already gotten around about the incident so i wanted you all to be the first to hear it from me before you hear it on the street. damn..i room full of strangers..what a great way to make a first impression. :)

ok..so i got this fish tank for valentine's day and i really wanted to have a pet shark but instead a got a bunch of feeder fishes. for some reason, they all got sick but one. the runt out of the group survived. she outlived all her brothers and sisters. then one day, i got a few guppies added to my tank but that didn't last long because they miracuously disappeared while i was on vacation. so now all i have is one guppy and a gold fish name wanda. i ran out of food a week ago...i've been neglecting them. i never really got to attached to the guppy but wanda, i did care about and i didn't want her to die. well, i was at my parent's house the other day and i saw my sister's turtle and thought about wanda. i asked my sis if i could have some of her turtle food for my fishy. yes i am lazy and didn't feel like going to the pet store. well when i got home, i crushed the turtle stick food and put one in the tank. wanda was so excited cuz she hasn't seen food in awhile. she went in for the food and she choked. the stick was too big for her little mouth. she was gagging. i didn't know what to do. i was so scared for her. i could see the food in her mouth. it was too hard for her to swallow it. a tear came to my eye...i felt my fish slipping away from me and if she died, it would have been all my fault. i called my friend and told him that my fish was choking. he was no help. he just laughed at me. so i hung up the phone and prayed that the food stick would just get soft so she could either swallow it or cough it up. after about 5 minutes of gagging, she coughed up the food. i was so relieved but then i saw her going for the food again but luckily it was soft enough for her to swallow. go figure. well that's my fish story. i hope i never have to live through that again. it was pretty traumatizing. but i did learn something...that maybe i shouldn't get a shark ..and not to feed wanda turtle food. :-)
